meanings.definition: To cause slight anger or irritation to
meanings.sent1: The loud music annoyed the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: She always annoys her little brother by teasing him.
meanings.sent3: The chirping bird annoyed the sleeping cat, making it twitch its ears.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet annoyed her like a persistent mosquito buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The constant beeping of the alarm clock annoyed him to the point of throwing it across the room.

meanings.sent1: He looked annoyed when his favorite show was interrupted.
meanings.sent2: She felt annoyed by the constant interruptions during her work.
meanings.sent3: The annoyed cat swatted at the playful puppy trying to get its attention.
meanings.sent4: The annoyed customer's voice was as sharp as a thorn on a rose.
meanings.sent5: The annoyed expression on her face was like a storm cloud ready to burst.
